xt:extension.xt:name: Literatum JATS (v0.8.3)

xt:description.h2: oXygen XML Editor framework for NISO JATS 1.0, adapted for Atypon’s Literatum platform
xt:description.p: NISO JATS Z39.96-2012 defines an XML-based format for the authoring, publication and archiving of journal articles and related information. Its design is based on the NLM Journal Archiving and Publishing DTDs through version 3.0.
For submission to its Literatum content delivery platform, Atypon requires some additional conventions to be observed. Most of them will be checked by Schematron rules.
Adaption of Wendell Piez’s original JATS framework was commissioned by Hogrefe Verlag, Göttingen, and was carried out by Gerrit Imsieke of le-tex publishing services.

Some Schematron rules in literatum_JATS.sch are specific to Hogrefe’s production or articles in the field of psychology. There is currently no other customization mechanism than to fork the project and build a customized framework.
